Name: Tundra Swan
How_to_identify: All white body with a black bill and noticeable yellow spot in front of the eye. Males and females are similar.
Diet: Aquatic plants, roots, seeds, and small aquatic animals

Name: Whooper Swan
How_to_identify: All white with a long neck and a black bill with a large triangular yellow patch. No noticeable sexual dimorphism.
Primary_colors_of_the_bird: White with black and yellow bill
Diet: Aquatic vegetation, small fish, and invertebrates

Name: Knob-billed Duck
How_to_identify: Males have a large black knob on the bill. Iridescent black and white plumage. Females are plainer and smaller without the knob.
Diet: Aquatic vegetation, seeds, small fish, and insects

Name: Common Shelduck
How_to_identify: Bold pattern with a chestnut band, white body, green head, and red bill. Males have a knob on their bill.
Primary_colors_of_the_bird: White, chestnut, green, with a red bill
Diet: Mollusks, small shellfish, aquatic insects, and plants

Name: Ruddy Shelduck
How_to_identify: Bright ruddy-orange body, pale head, and black flight feathers. Both sexes look similar, but males have a black ring at the base of the bill.
Diet: Grains, grasses, leaves, and small invertebrates

Name: White-winged Duck
Habitat: dense forests, near rivers and swamps
How_to_identify: Large size, dark body with white wing patches visible in flight, red bill and legs. Males slightly larger than females.
Primary_colors_of_the_bird: Dark brown, white wing patches, red bill
Diet: Seeds, aquatic plants, insects, and small fish

Name: Mandarin Duck
How_to_identify: Males are multicolored with ornate plumage, females are duller with grey head. Distinctive sail-like wings in males.
Primary_colors_of_the_bird: Males: Multicolored. Females: Grey and brown
Diet: Plants, seeds, small fish, and insects

Name: Wood Duck
How_to_identify: Males have iridescent plumage and distinctive red eyes, females are grey-brown with a white eye-ring. Unique shape among ducks.
Diet: Seeds, fruits, insects, and aquatic invertebrates

Name: Cotton Pygmy Goose
How_to_identify: Small size, white body with black wings. Males have a black ring around the neck, females have a more subtle ring.
Diet: Aquatic plants, seeds, and small invertebrates

Name: Baikal Teal
How_to_identify: Males have a striking green nape, spotted chest, and yellow forewing. Females are mottled brown with a less distinct face pattern.
Primary_colors_of_the_bird: Males: Green, brown, yellow. Females: Mottled brown
Diet: Seeds, aquatic invertebrates, and small fish
